reason: The '_journalSizeThreshold' configuration in the Prevayler software project directly influences how much data is stored in the journal before being flushed to the database. A lower threshold may lead to more frequent writes, increasing I/O operations and potentially causing significant variations in execution time and memory consumption. Conversely, a higher threshold may result in larger journal sizes, affecting memory usage and the time taken for recovery processes. Therefore, changes to this configuration can have a notable impact on overall system performance.
